Foreign portfolio investors continued to sell shares.

title: Banks want RBI to inject Rs 3-5 lakh crore via OMO
summary: Indian lenders are pushing the Reserve Bank of India to commit to substantial open market operations (OMOs) of at least ₹3-5 lakh crore. This move aims to ease liquidity, lower yields, and boost credit growth. Economists also voiced concerns about inflation and GDP data uncertainty, urging caution on rate cuts until new figures are released.

title: IIFL nosedives 17% after receiving income-tax notice

title: ET@Davos 2026: ‘India has already arrived, no longer an emerging market,’ says Blackstone CEO Schwarzman

Revenue remained flat at Rs 7,074 crore, with EBITDA also declining. The company plans upcoming launches to offset revenue decline and drive future growth.

summary: The sharpest single-day fall in the dollar occurred on January 20, 2025, the day of Trump’s inauguration as the 47th US President. The USD plunged 1.38% against the euro, as investors reassessed potential policy risks and uncertainties.

title: Market share, share market & sustainable wealth creation: 6 large-cap stocks with an upside potential of up to 36%
summary: We are not saying the New World Order should be ignored (even though it is one in which a President is running amok and the commerce secretary of the world’s largest economy is heckled at a global event). But remember: Strong businesses have endured many presidents, and this one will be no exception. So, as an investor, just focus on fundamental questions: Does the company have something which gives it an advantage over others? If yes, for how long will it be able to keep that advantage? If the answer is for the foreseeable future, then it is worth looking at. One such advantage is large market share, because it is probably the most difficult to build. And if it has been built over a period of time, it is an advantage that deserves a premium.

title: Stock Radar: JB Chemicals hit fresh record high in January 2026 post breakout from rectangular pattern; time to buy the dip?
summary: JB Chemicals hit a record high after breaking out of a two-month rectangular pattern. Analysts see buying on dips, citing rising volumes, improving momentum and strong technical structure, with a potential target of Rs 2,100 over the next two to three months.

summary: Indian stock markets and commodity exchanges will remain closed on January 26 for Republic Day. Trading resumes January 27. The holiday begins a 15-day closure calendar for 2026, as investors navigate markets amid global trade tensions, FII outflows and earnings.
